actions.recommendation: "Please report any new worrying urinary symptoms to your doctor."

"PSA testing: annually, from age 40 if one first-degree relative who had prostate cancer at <65yrs or female relatives diagnosed with BRCA1 or BRCA2 gene mutation breast cancer. From age 45: if history of prostate cancer on either the mother or father’s side. From age 50: every 2 years"
"High-sensitivity C-reactive protein (hsCRP) is a marker of inflammation that predicts incident heart attacks, stroke and arterial disease. A level lower than 1 is ideal"
Please report any new worrying urinary symptoms to your doctor.

PSA testing: annually, from age 40: if one first-degree relative who had prostate cancer at <65yrs or female relatives diagnosed with BRCA1 or BRCA2 gene mutation breast cancer. From age 45: if history of prostate cancer on either the mother or father’s side.From age 50: every 2 years
Your blood pressure is a bit borderline and needs to be reviewed again in a month. You may need treatment if it remains raised.
